aws::graph::propositions: # Factual Information about Aircraft Incident
The defining event was a runway excursion during landing.
Loss of control on ground occurred during landing roll.
The pilot held a Private certificate.
The pilot was 85 years old.
The pilot had Single-engine land airplane rating.
The pilot had no Other Aircraft Rating.
The pilot had no Instrument Rating.
No second pilot was present during the incident.
The pilot had no Instructor Rating.
No toxicology was performed on the pilot.
The pilot had Class 3 Medical Certification with waivers/limitations.
The pilot's last FAA Medical Exam was on May 19, 2012.
The pilot was not an Occupational Pilot.
The aircraft make was KERR MATTHEW.
The aircraft registration was N159MK.
The aircraft model/series was STARDUSTER TOO.
The aircraft category was Airplane.
The aircraft was Amateur Built.
The aircraft had an Experimental (Special) Airworthiness Certificate.
The aircraft serial number was MK-2.
The aircraft had Tailwheel landing gear type.
The aircraft had 2 seats.
The aircraft had 1 Reciprocating engine.
The engine manufacturer was LYCOMING.
The engine model/series was 0-435.
The registered owner was Matthew Kerr.
The engine was rated at 175 Horsepower.
The operator was Matthew Kerr.
No Operating Certificates were held by the operator.
